item.title: Adding custom loginbox + buttons for Project Fubergen Clients
item.dc:creator: @Sir_roju Sir roju
item.description:
@Sir_roju wrote:

This tutorial is for, who is using Project Fubergen clients eg. 7.0 Alpha , 7.1 Beta or 7.2 [Xmas Edition] and those wants get custom loginbox + button.

Note: This should works on others client too [you only need change those getimage things]

Note: add Attached files to .fub_file_store_32" -> sprites
To get your own look loginbox + buttons , follow this tutorial

In this tutorial, we gonna edit lil

Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java

search

else if (s.startsWith(“headicons_hint”) && i == 2)

after that add this


else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("titlebutton"))
		{
		try
		{
						Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(".fub_file_store_32/Sprites/loginbutton.png");
						anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
						PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
						pixelgrabber.grabPixels();
						
					}
					catch (Exception exception)
					{
						System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
					}
				}
else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("titlebox"))
{
try
{
				Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(".fub_file_store_32/Sprites/loginbox.png");			//System.getProperty("user.dir") + "\\"+i+".png");
				anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
				PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
				pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

			}
			catch (Exception exception)
			{
				System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
			}
		}

after that compile , then just go to cache folder that is called “.fub_file_store_32” -> sprites -> then find loginbox and loginbutton. Just replace it with your own. Remember same file name

here is proof

smaw49.png772×589

Read full topic
item.source: Adding custom loginbox + buttons for Project Fubergen Clients
